text:
Svidrigaïlov entered the tiny room. 

“Is there tea?” he asked. 

“Yes, sir.” 

“What else?” 

“Veal, vodka, savouries.” 

“Bring me tea and veal.” 

The ragged man left, surprised. 

Svidrigaïlov thought, “How did I not know this place?” 

He lit a candle and examined the room. 

It was cramped and low. 

The bed was dirty. 

The chair and table barely fit. 

Yellowed walls were torn and dusty. 

He sat on the bed, lost in thought. 

A strange murmur rose from the next room.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov reflects on his surroundings in a cramped, shabby room while waiting for tea and veal.
